description:
The studious Yatora leaves a dry life of study and good manners behind for a new passion: painting. But untethering yourself from all your past expectations is dangerous as well as thrilling…

(Source: Kodansha USA)

Note: The anime premiered on Netflix on Sep 25, 2021 in Japan. The TV broadcast started on Oct 2, 2021.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/28_3) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_I0zTgZqix95l63q3dBMKg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ryuji_ayukawa/) | [Blog](http://t8s2.jugem.jp/)**

After her graduation from Tokyo University of Arts, she received the Afternoon Prize for Young Mangaka in 2014. She later made her debut in Good! Afternoon with two one shots ("Nude Model" and "Onna no Ko", both in 2015). In 2016, she published her first full series in Monthly Afternoon, a manga adaptation of "She and Her Cat". One year later she launched her second series, "Blue Period", in the same magazine.

She got married in 2019.

In November 2023 she announced a hiatus due to her pregnancy.
Notable directorial works include [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/), [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/) and [Magi](https://anilist.co/anime/14513/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Website](https://omoinotake.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Omoinotakey) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/omoinotake/ | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv1jAWnr9rPKRQsEZYl5izQ)

__Omoinotake__ is a three piece Japanese band from Matsue City, Shimane Prefecture.

Members:
- Leo Fujii (Vocals, Keyboardist)
- Tomoaki Fukushima (Bassist, Chorus)
- Tomita Hiroyuki (Drummer, Chorus)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.

__[Profile (Creek Ltd.)](http://www.creekltd.com/inoue.html)__
[Twitter](https://x.com/three3i_1983)

__Ippei Inoue__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.
__Yasuhira Sakai__ is a Japanese music producer.
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

[Instagram](http://www.instagram.com/leonardosanthos) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/leonardosanthos) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/leonardosanthos) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@FalaCritica) | [Twitch](http://www.twitch.tv/FalaCritica)

Leonardo Santhos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and streamer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Blitzcrank, the Great Steam Golem / Kog'Maw, The Mouth of the Abyss / Vel'Koz, the Eye of the Void / Wukong, the Monkey King (League of Legends)
- Pierce Wheels (Ben 10: Alien Force)
- Peter "Pete" Devin / Master Carter (BONDiNG)
- Agent Bratcher (Outer Banks)
- Henrich Zemo / Baron Zemo (1st voice; The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes)
- Soren (The Dragon Prince)
- Myst (Grand Chase: Dimensional Chaser)
- Spartan Jared Miller (Halo 4)
- Tetsuya Fukazawa (Ju-On: Origins)
- Kyd Miller (1st voice - 10th season; The X-Files)
- Onix (Gears of War: Judgement)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/erickbglx) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/erickbglx/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/ErickDublou)

Erick Bougleux is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director.
